name: Number of positive integers with a shortest addition-subtraction chain of length n.
link: Index to sequences related to the complexity of n
example: a(6) = 16 because the number of occurrences of 6 in A128998 is 16. These numbers are 19, 21, 22, 23, 25, 26, 27, 28, 30, 31, 33, 34, 36, 40, 48, 64.
author: _Jinyuan Wang_, Apr 17 2025

name: Smallest positive integer with shortest addition-subtraction chain of length n.
link: Index to sequences related to the complexity of n
example: a(8) = 53 because 53 is the smallest positive integer k such that A128998(k) = 8. An example of a shortest addition-subtraction chain for 53 is (1 2 3 4 7 14 25 28 53). a(8) > A003064(8) because an optimal chain for A003064(8) = 47 has length 7: (1 2 3 6 12 24 23 47).
author: _Jinyuan Wang_, Apr 17 2025
